      • findMinDiff

        public static int findMinDiff​(int[] a,
                              int x,
                              int y)

        Exercise 1: Find Minimum Difference

        This method gets an array of integers, and 2 integers and returns the minimum differnce between the two indexes that contains
        the given 2 integers. if at least one doesn't exist in the array, the method returns integer max value.
        Parameters:
        a - An integer array to look for minimum difference between indexes of the given two integers.
        x - The first integer to look for the minimum difference between it and the second integer.
        y - The second integer to look for the minimum difference between it and the first integer.
        Returns:
        The minimum distance between the two integers, or integer max value if at least one of the itegers doesn't exist in the array.

        Time complexity of this method is O(n). The array is not Sorted, so it is needed to iterate to whole array in order to determine the
        minimum difference between the two given values. If the array size is n, then the method does a constant amount of actions multiplied by n,
        which means - time complexity O(n).

        Space complexity of this method is O(1). the method initializes 7 variables, which means space complexity of O(7), which equals to O(1).

      • search

        public static boolean search​(int[][] mat,
                             int num)

        Exercise 2: Search In Circle Sorted Matrix

        This methods gets a circle sorted two dimensional
        Parameters:
        mat - A circle sorted matrix with a dimension of powers of 2, to search the given value in.
        num - The integer value to search in the given matrix.
        Returns:
        True if the number is in the matrix, or false otherwise.

        Time complexity of this method is O(LOG N), because after each time the method does the search,
        and determines in which quarter to keep looking, it divides the dimension by 2.
        Therfore, the dimension is decreasing in a binary search way, and the amount of actions in each search is constant.

        Space complexity O(1). I used constant number of variables: 7, which means O(7), that equals to space complexity of O(1)

      • equalSplit

        public static boolean equalSplit​(int[] arr)

        Exercise 3: equal split (Recursion)

        This method gets an array, and return true if its possible to divide the array to two equal groups,
        which equals by the amount of elements and by the sum of each group.
        Parameters:
        arr - An integer array to check and perform the method on.
        Returns:
        True if its possible to divide the given array according to the requirements, false otherwise.

      • isSpecial

        public static boolean isSpecial​(int n)

        Exercise 4: Special Numbers (Recursion)

        This method gets an integer, and checks if it is a "Special Number" according to the rules: The rules: formula is executed on all the natural numbers, at first, starting from 1, each 2 indexes is to be removed, then each 3, then each 4 and so on. if a number is not removed, it means that it is a "Special Number"
        Parameters:
        n - A given integer to check if it is a "Special Number".
        Returns:
        True if the number given as a parameter is indeed a "Special Number", false otherwise.
